meanings.definition: Not pleasing to the taste; disagreeable or offensive.
meanings.sent1: The unsavory smell from the garbage made me cover my nose.
meanings.sent2: The unsavory food left a bad taste in my mouth.
meanings.sent3: The unsavory combination of pickles and ice cream made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The unsavory truth about the situation was finally revealed.
meanings.sent5: The unsavory experience of getting lost in the dark forest was terrifying.

meanings.sent1: The unsavory character of the villain made the audience dislike him.
meanings.sent2: The unsavory behavior of cheating is never acceptable.
meanings.sent3: The unsavory joke crossed the line and upset many people.
meanings.sent4: The unsavory decision to lie about the incident only made things worse.
meanings.sent5: The unsavory actions of the corrupt politician were exposed by the media.
